content.rendered:
Q1: Why does the cellphone get sizzling when it is charging?

A: This is regular, as a result of the cellphone will generate some warmth when it’s charging. However, the primary causes for the warmth are as follows:

1. The charging pace shall be quicker when the cellphone energy is low, the wall charger will output 9V excessive voltage, and the cellphone will generate warmth due to the voltage changing course of.

2. There are too many applications operating within the background of the cellphone, inflicting the cellphone to run at a excessive load and generate extra warmth.

Recommendations:

1. Clean up the operating program of the cellphone with excessive energy consumption within the background in time.

2. Don’t play the cellphone whereas the cellphone is charged with low energy, in any other case the cellphone shall be in a excessive load state.

About the error message “This accessory may not be supported by device”:

The message would seem for those who had been utilizing a non-Apple wall charger or in poor contact, however even in case you are utilizing an Apple accent, the error may occur for the firmware downside with iOS.

After evaluation, the causes of this downside will be the following:

  • Device lightning port incorporates impurities resembling fiber and particles, leading to poor contact.
  • The voltage of the wall charger is just too low or unstable, leading to inadequate energy provide.
  • The lightning finish is corroded/stained, leading to poor contact.
  • Circuit logic issues/system issues with charging gear.
  • The chip or mainboard of the cable is broken.

You can attempt the next options:

  1. You can use a pushpin to clear out the pocket lint or particles from the charging port.
  2. Wipe the Lightning finish with a tissue to take away filth and oxidation marks on the lightning finish.
  3. Use the unique charger or MFi approved charger, as a result of some laptop computer USB output ports could have inadequate energy output.
